intro: Ipomoea coptica subvar. malvifolia, commonly known as the velvetleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its heart-shaped, velvety leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant is a herbaceous annual that thrives in moist, sunny environments. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is known for its rapid growth and ability to spread through seeds and rhizomes. Its botanical features make it both a useful ornamental plant and a potential weed in agricultural settings.
